title: PREVIEW: Brentford host struggling Brighton with Europe on the radar
description: Brentford seek to edge closer to a first-every appearance in Europe against a Brighton side with no wins in 13 matches at the Gtech Community Stadium.The Bees have performed extremely well this season...
fullText:
Brentford seek to edge closer to a first-every appearance in Europe against a Brighton side with no wins in 13 matches at the Gtech Community Stadium.

The Bees have performed extremely well this season and occupy seventh place in the Premier League, which is not a position they would‚Äôve expected to be in having promoted Keith Andrews to Thomas Frank‚Äôs old hotseat.

Andrews has stepped into the role as Brentford boss and has ticked all the boxes, with his side going toe-to-toe with league leaders Arsenal in their last top-flight match and claiming a point at home.

For Brentford, Kevin Schade is available after serving his three-match ban for seeing red against Aston Villa earlier in the month.

Minutes were managed for Igor Thiago, Jordan Henderson, Mikkel Damsgaard and Caoimh√≠n Kelleher, who were all absent from the FA Cup squad which beat Macclesfield, so they are likely to return to the fold tomorrow.

But Joshua DaSilva, F√°bio Carvalho and Antoni Milambo all remain out through knee injuries.

The Seagulls are navigating a very difficult period compared to their opponents at the weekend, with the last league win for Fabian H√ºrzeler‚Äôs side ‚Äì now likely a distant memory to Brighton fans ‚Äì came against relegation-threatened Burnley at the beginning of January.

Sitting in 14th place, Brighton are just seven points above the relegation zone and are in need of wins soon in order to avoid being dragged into the relegation scrap.

In the reverse fixture, Brentford suffered a narrow 2-1 defeat with a penalty converted early by Igor Thiago but conceded goals from Danny Welbeck and Jack Hinshelwood in the second half.

The Gtech Community Stadium has been a formidable ground this season, with a minimal two defeats in West London; only Arsenal, Man City and Sunderland have fewer, with one.

Positive injury news arrived for H√ºrzeler, as Solly March has a good chance of featuring after being present in full training and gaining match-sharpness with the U21s.

The Englishman last played a competitive match in September 2024 and will be eager to get back on the pitch after a long stint out.

Although Yasin Ayari is not available for the upcoming trip to West London, he is close to returning to the squad, but Stefanos Tzimas and Adam Webster are both out long-term.

The match kicks off on Saturday the 21st February (15:00 GMT).

title: Proposed Twins signing sees Minnesota acquire $61 million All-Star, former Cy Young candidate ace as insurance for Pablo Lopez
description: This could be a solid move by Minnesota.
fullText:
Proposed Twins signing sees Minnesota acquire $61 million All-Star, former Cy Young candidate ace as insurance for Pablo Lopez originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Minnesota Twins have really been quiet this offseason, after making it seem like they were blowing up at last season‚Äôs trade deadline. However, they‚Äôve made no moves, and still have something resembling a contender on their hands.

With that in mind, they need to capitalize if they don‚Äôt rebuild, and the first thing they need to do is find a temporary replacement and insurance for their injured No. 2 pitcher, Pablo Lopez. Fansided‚Äôs Robert Murray believes the Twins should target former All-Star Lucas Giolito as their answer.

MORE:¬†Proposed Phillies trade sees Philadelphia deal Edmundo Sosa, Orion Kerkering to solve two major roster issues

‚ÄúThe Twins are not the first team you‚Äôd imagine when thinking about Giolito, but they were on Framber Valdez and have shown interest in fortifying their rotation this offseason. Giolito could be a short-term solution that they trade at the deadline for prospects, something that a rebuilding team should strongly consider. He‚Äôd also be tremendous insurance for Pablo Lopez, who is out with an elbow injury that is being further evaluated‚Äù Kline wrote.

Giolito finished 2025 with a 10-4 record, a 3.41 ERA, 121 Ks, and a WHIP of 1.290 over 145 innings pitched. He would definitely be a top three arm in their rotation, and gives the Twins a nice 1-2-3 punch.

MORE:¬†Braves predicted to be forced into signing $61 million All-Star, former Cy Young candidate after latest Hurston Waldrep injury update

And, while he‚Äôs projected to receive a three-year, $61 million deal, the fact that his market hasn‚Äôt heated up at all with Opening Day almost here, means the Twins could get him on a bargain.

Hopefully, they do and have a solid rotation for this upcoming season.

title: Liverpool and Arsenal keeping tabs on Bayern Munich youngster Lennart Karl
description: Reports from Germany suggest Liverpool and Arsenal are both keeping tabs on Bayern Munich youngster Lennart Karl. One of the more noticeable shifts in Liverpool‚Äôs recruitment strategy has been a stronger emphasis on signing younger players with long-term upside.
fullText:
Reports from Germany suggest Liverpool and Arsenal are both keeping tabs on Bayern Munich youngster Lennart Karl.

One of the more noticeable shifts in Liverpool‚Äôs recruitment strategy has been a stronger emphasis on signing younger players with long-term upside. January saw them make a ¬£60m move for 20-year-old Jeremy Doku, while also adding more teenagers to their youth set-up.

Karl‚Äôs agent, Kevin R√§ber, was asked about potential interest in the 18-year-old midfielder during an interview with Sky Germany, but he chose to remain tight-lipped.

The report says that ‚Äúmany clubs‚Äù are looking at the teenager right now. But another name mentioned is Arsenal, who have already made one major addition from Bayern‚Äôs ranks by signing Joshua Kimmich this summer.

Graeme Bailey from TeamTalk reports that both clubs are keeping a close eye on the young midfielder.

Karl is contracted to Bayern until 2028, giving the German club some leverage in any future negotiations. Both clubs are said to be monitoring his progress closely.

While Real Madrid, Barcelona, and PSG are also reported to be interested in Karl, it‚Äôs the English sides‚ÄîArsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool and Manchester City‚Äîwho are reportedly tracking him most closely at this stage.

Bayern aren‚Äôt sitting idle either. They‚Äôre currently in talks with Karl over a new four-year contract extension, which could complicate any potential move.

Muller praised Karl‚Äôs technical abilities late last year:

‚ÄùHis shooting technique is certainly exceptional. He has very good finishing,‚Äù Muller said. ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äôs already an excellent asset to have because if you play in attack for FC Bayern and you‚Äôre energetic and agile, you‚Äôll constantly find yourself in scoring positions.‚Äù

title: Home Spoils: Italy‚Äôs Medal Count Surges at the 2026 Winter Olympics
description: MILAN ‚Äî Federica Brignone has skied in five Winter Olympics, but her experience this year has been unique. For starters, she won her first gold medals. She also had an easier commute. ‚ÄúI had never arrived at an Olympics with my car,‚Äù Brignone, who was born in Milan and lives in Northern Italy, told reporters ‚Ä¶
fullText:
MILAN ‚Äî Federica Brignone has skied in five Winter Olympics, but her experience this year has been unique. For starters, she won her first gold medals. She also had an easier commute.

‚ÄúI had never arrived at an Olympics with my car,‚Äù Brignone, who was born in Milan and lives in Northern Italy, told reporters before the Games. ‚ÄúUsually it was always hotels, all shuttles, everything already organized.‚Äù

Olympics Ratings Remain White-Hot as USA Sniffs Double Hockey Gold

Alysa Liu's Figure Skating Gold Breaks 24-Year U.S. Olympic Drought

Figure Skating, Hockey Fans Face Overlapping Schedule

Familiar comforts may be one of many factors driving the resurgent Olympics performance of Brignone and the rest of her Italian teammates. With a few events remaining this weekend, Italy has won 26 medals and nine golds at this year‚Äôs Winter Games, both records for the country. After ranking 10th in the medal table four years ago in Beijing, Italy sits in third so far this year, behind Norway and the United States.

The host boost is a trend that holds across both the Summer and Winter Olympics in recent decades. Since World War II, 18 of 19 Winter Olympics hosts‚Äîand 17 of 19 in the summer‚Äîhave improved their medal counts from the previous games, with a median increase of 60% and a median gold medal increase of more than 75%. Ironically, the lone exception was Italy in 2006, when it won two fewer medals in Turin than it did in 2002.

Host nations typically have a long run-up of preparation‚ÄîItaly was awarded the 2026 Games seven years ago‚Äîmeaning the country can dedicate time, money and infrastructure to its Olympic pursuits. While some countries allocate part of their Olympic budgets or resources to high-performance training, the Italian national team told Sportico that the $6.1 billion (‚Ç¨5.2 billion) Milan Cortina budget did not directly increase the country‚Äôs funding for its athlete development.

‚ÄúThe medals are the result of hard work,‚Äù a spokesperson for the Italian national Olympic committee (CONI) said in an email. ‚ÄúWe have not given the athletes any additional funding. We have assisted them in their preparation and with their staffing needs.‚Äù

From a medal perspective, the return on investment was a jackpot. Great Britain won 29 golds in 2012, up from 19 in 2008 and still the nation‚Äôs biggest haul ever.

Technical and scientific support for the Italian athletes this year came via the country‚Äôs Olympic training centers (Centri di Preparazione Olimpica) and the Institute of Sports Medicine and Science (l‚ÄôIstituto di Medicina e Scienza dello Sport), the CONI spokesperson said. The result of that push, he added, has shown in other avenues. Italy finished atop the gold medal count at the 2024 Winter Youth Olympics in South Korea, beating out France, Germany and the event hosts. Italy wasn‚Äôt in the top 10 for the 2012, 2016 or 2020 iterations of that event.

Italian standouts during these Olympics include Brignone, who Corriere dello Sport¬†hailed as ‚ÄúThe Queen‚Äù; speedskater Francesca Lollobrigida, who won two gold medals; and the nation‚Äôs first-everbiathlon gold medalist Lisa Vittozzi. Italy also secured a surprise bronze medal in the team figure skating event. Pairs skater Sara Conti said afterward that the local support helped her team.

‚ÄúA competition is a competition,‚Äù she told reporters, ‚Äúbut when you feel the public behind you, that makes things much easier.‚Äù

There are a few structural factors that benefit Olympic hosts. For one, organizing committees can push to add new sports or new disciplines, and often do so in ways that boost their medal hauls. The lineup for the 2028 Summer Games in Los Angeles, for example, includes newcomers flag football, lacrosse, baseball and softball, all sports where the U.S. teams will likely be medal favorites.

The Winter Olympics introduces new events more gradually than the Summer Games, but several host countries have capitalized on new medal opportunities. For instance, the United States won both gold medals in skeleton when the discipline was resurrected (after a half-century hiatus) in Salt Lake City in 2002, and Russia won gold in men‚Äôs parallel slalom in that snowboarding event‚Äôs first iteration in 2014.

These Winter Games featured one new sport‚Äîski mountaineering, or skimo‚Äîwhich features a number of prominent Italians. The hosts failed to medal in the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs sprint on Thursday, but have another shot in Saturday‚Äôs mixed relay. Another new medal event, women‚Äôs doubles luge, produced an Italian gold. The host nation also auto-qualifies in many Olympic sports and receives additional slots in others, though those rarely result in medals. The Italian men‚Äôs hockey team, which didn‚Äôt have to qualify for the tournament, was winless in four games and was outscored 22-4.

Lastly, there are also more medals available by absence. Due to sanctions from the ongoing war in Ukraine, the Russian contingent has fewer than two dozen athletes at the 2026 Winter Games, competing as ‚Äúindividual neutral athletes,‚Äù and they‚Äôve won one medal. By contrast, Russia initially claimed 33 medals, more than the U.S. or Canada, when it hosted the Olympics in 2014. Four of those medals were stripped for doping at those Sochi Games, bringing the final count to 29. Its athletes won 17 and 32 medals in the 2018 and 2022 Winter Games, when they faced separate restrictions due to doping violations.

The increased medal haul doesn‚Äôt mean the local Olympics have been blemish-free for Italy. The spread-out nature of the Games has diluted the overall Olympic energy in Milan. Offensive and gaffe-riddled commentary during the Opening Ceremony prompted the resignation of Paolo Petrecca, the sports head of RAI, the Italian state broadcaster.

title: Abhishek Sharma to get dropped? India coach makes fresh admission amid poor T20 World Cup form
description: India opener Abhishek Sharma has struggled in the T20 World Cup with three ducks, but the team management continues to back him. Coach Morne Morkel said there is no talk of dropping him. Sunil Gavaskar feels pressure is affecting his game and advised him to build innings patiently. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said Abhishek showed good form in the nets and should bounce back in the Super 8s.
fullText:
Team India bowling coach Morne Morkel dismissed any talk of dropping him and said, "Absolutely no discussion on Abhishek Sharma in the group. He is going to deliver, for the team and viewers. He is entertaining. He is hitting the ball well in the nets."

Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar feels pressure is affecting the 25-year-old batter. He believes Abhishek is trying too hard to hit big shots from the first ball instead of settling in. 

‚ÄúAbhishek Sharma is a lovely guy, but expectations seem to be weighing on him. If he had started well against the USA, it would have been different. Now, the pressure of being the big six-hitter and top batter is showing," Gavaskar said.

"With his shot range, he needs to spend time in the middle. He cannot try to hit a boundary or six on the first ball of his innings. If the big shots come, fine. But he shouldn‚Äôt force himself to play the big shots across the line,‚Äù he added.

He also advised Abhishek to start slowly and build his innings. 

‚ÄúTake a single and get off the mark. Even four dot balls don‚Äôt matter. He can make up for them later. He needs to play smart. Spend an hour or two settling in, then play his natural game. First, just get off the mark. Every batter wants that first run. Once he gets it, everything will fall into place,‚Äù he added.

Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate also backed Abhishek and said he showed good form in training after recovering from illness. 

He said Abhishek batted well in the nets and should be fine in the next phase.

With India reaching the Super 8s, the team hopes Abhishek will regain confidence and perform when it matters most.

title: Casemiro drops hint over his next destination
description: Manchester United‚Äôs midfield will be severely weakened following Casemiro‚Äôs summer exit.The Brazilian, who had lost his way under Erik ten Hag and Ruben Amorim, has been in scintillating form this...
fullText:
Manchester United‚Äôs midfield will be severely weakened following Casemiro‚Äôs summer exit.

The Brazilian, who had lost his way under Erik ten Hag and Ruben Amorim, has been in scintillating form this season and has been an ever-present member of the starting XI under Michael Carrick.

There were murmurs that INEOS were considering offering a short-term deal on the condition that the former Real Madrid superstar agreed to take a pay cut.

That did not materialise, and the defensive midfielder ended up announcing his departure five months ahead of time.

United are likely to target the addition of two midfielders to compensate for losing the 33-year-old. As for the five-time Champions League winner, he is trying to find his next home.

There are offers from the Middle East as well as his homeland, but he seems to prefer a switch across the Atlantic.

Among the numerous Major League Soccer clubs eyeing his signature, one of them is Inter Miami, owned by United legend David Beckham.

According to The Sun, Casemiro has been spotted scouting the area in Florida, hinting at a possible move.

‚ÄúCasemiro has drawn interest from both Inter Miami and his boyhood club. The Brazil legend will leave Old Trafford when his contract expires at the end of the season.

‚ÄúCasemiro, who turns 34 next week, was spotted enjoying a mini winter break in Miami with wife Anna this week.

‚ÄúSunSport understands that Casemiro was in Florida to scout the area as he considers his options after the US World Cup in June.

‚ÄúMiami has placed Casemiro high on their midfield wishlist as they prepare for life without Sergio Busquets, who plans to retire at the end of the MLS campaign.‚Äù

A move to the Chase Stadium would see Casemiro reunite with former Barcelona foe Lionel Messi. Not many would have envisaged such a link-up even a few years ago. How times change!

Feature image Carl Recine via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Russia's Skating Dynasty Crumbled Before Our Eyes At Winter Olympics
description: The longtime superpower faces an uncertain future on ice.
fullText:
A high-risk jump, a fall, gasps from the crowd. That‚Äôs how Russia‚Äôs domination of¬†Olympic¬†women‚Äôs figure skating ended.

Adeliia Petrosian¬†came to Milan¬†as one of the few leading medal contenders on the 13-strong ‚Äúindividual neutral athlete‚Äù delegation of Russians competing¬†without the country‚Äôs flag and symbols.

Sports: Elieen Gu Bounces Back In Women's Halfpipe Following Wicked Opening Run Crash

Starting the day fifth in the standings, Petrosian‚Äôs medal hopes rested on her not-so-secret weapon, quadruple jumps which no one else in the event could perform.

Petrosian planned two, fell on the first quad toeloop and thought she‚Äôd like to ‚Äúget up and leave quickly,‚Äù she said. The 18-year-old skater didn‚Äôt risk a second quad attempt.

Petrosian said returning to Russia would be ‚Äúmentally hard‚Äù and that she blamed herself.

‚ÄúRight now I‚Äôm just a bit ashamed for myself, the federation, the coaches, the spectators that it turned out like that,‚Äù she added.

Petrosian was sixth, while Alysa Liu¬†won a historic gold¬†for the U.S. It was the first time since 2010 that a Russian skater didn‚Äôt win the women‚Äôs gold. There were no medals of any kind in figure skating at these Olympics for the sport‚Äôs longtime superpower, which had only two competitors.

Like this article? Keep independent journalism alive. Support HuffPost.

The ‚Äúindividual neutral athlete‚Äù delegation has one medal after¬†Nikita Filippov‚Äôs silver¬†in a new sport, ski mountaineering, earlier Thursday. He said it was ‚Äúhard‚Äù to see other athletes able to compete in their countries‚Äô colors.

Russia hasn‚Äôt competed under its own flag at any Olympics since 2016, first over doping issues, then International Olympic Committee restrictions imposed during Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine.

Sports: Team USA Women's Hockey Prevails In OT, Secures Gold Over Canada

Still, the IOC‚Äôs approach to the conflict has been a constant point of discussion at the Milan Cortina Games, especially when a Ukrainian was¬†excluded from competing¬†over his plans to compete in a helmet bearing pictures of Ukrainian athletes and coaches who have been killed.

Petrosian said she hopes to be back at the next Olympics. Her skate came amid a gradual loosening of restrictions on Russian athletes in international sports.

Athletes from Russia and its ally Belarus are set to compete¬†with their national flags and anthems¬†at next month‚Äôs Paralympics for the first time since 2022. The International Olympic Committee has recommended similar steps for¬†Russian youth athletes¬†since December.

Ukraine‚Äôs sports minister Matvii Bidnyi¬†told The Associated Press¬†this month that any change to Russia‚Äôs Olympic status would be ‚Äúirresponsible‚Äù and appear to condone Russia‚Äôs invasion as the war‚Äôs fourth anniversary approaches.

Asked what she thought about her fans in the crowd being unable to fly Russian flags ‚Äî barred from the Games under the IOC‚Äôs neutral athlete rules ‚Äî and about a potential Russian return to the Olympics, Petrosian opted simply to praise her fans.

‚ÄúI heard everything they were shouting, how our Russian-speaking spectators supported me,‚Äù Petrosian said. ‚ÄúOf course it‚Äôs pleasant.‚Äù

title: Florida Senate passes Teddy Bridgewater Act for coaches in state
description: The Florida Senate passed the Teddy Bridgewater act to help coaches in the state being able to provide for it's players.
fullText:
Northwestern (Miami) alumnus Teddy Bridgewater continues to make an impact on his community, despite not being the head coach for his former high school.

On Thursday, the Florida State Senate proposed the Teddy Bridgewater Act, which would allow K-12 head coaches to use $15,000 in personal funds per year to support student-athlete welfare. The state has 38 senators, and the bill, titled officially CS/CS/SB 178, was unanimously passed by a vote of 38-0.

The bill reads, ". . .the Florida High School Athletic Association to adopt bylaws authorizing a head coach to support the welfare of a student by using personal funds to provide certain effects to the student; requiring the head coach to report such use of personal funds to the association; providing that such use of personal funds is presumed not to be an impermissible benefit, etc."

Bridgewater returned to his alma mater to become their head football coach in 2024. He made his impact known quickly by leading them to a Class 3A state title in 2024. Shortly after that accomplishment, he admitted to covering food and transportation costs for his players to improve their living conditions and ensure their safety getting to and from football-related activities.

While Bridgewater's high school coaching career was cut short, he can at least feel good knowing his sacrifice at the time will leave a lasting impact on not only his community but the entire state of Florida.

This article originally appeared on Bucs Wire: Florida Senate passes Teddy Bridgewater Act for coaches to help

title: Question marks for each position along Packers offensive line
description: The Packers offensive line underperformed in 2025, and there are question marks at each position up front entering 2026.
fullText:
The Green Bay Packers underperformed along the offensive line in nearly every meaningful way during the 2025 season. Pass protection. Run blocking. Continuity. Development. Last month, Mark Oldacres of Packers Wire did a terrific job of highlighting the unusually poor season from the offensive line here. When push came to shove, a disappointing second half from the Packers offensive line stunted the offense and allowed the Chicago Bears the opportunity to mount a historic comeback -- knocking Matt LaFleur's team out of the playoffs in the wild card round for the second straight season.

A top priority for the Packers in 2026 will be engineering improvement along the offensive line, but question marks are abundant entering the offseason.

At each position up front on offense, the Packers have at least one question mark. This won't even get into depth issues -- we're only discussing likely starters here.

Will Rasheed Walker depart in free agency, and is Jordan Morgan up to the task if Walker leaves? Walker looks all but guaranteed to depart. He's a top free agent offensive lineman in the class, and there will be teams needing better left tackle play who are willing to pay the price. Assuming Walker leaves, the left tackle position will transition into the hands of Jordan Morgan, a 2024 first-round pick who has bounced around to various positions over his first two seasons. He'll need to settle in quick at left tackle. The good news: Morgan was a collegiate left tackle at Arizona, and he played some of his best football as a pro at left tackle in the preseason of 2025 and at right tackle to end the regular season. It's possible he could give the Packers improvement over Walker as soon as 2026. But there are always question marks when a new player is taking over a premium position.

Will Aaron Banks return, and can be bounce back from a disappointing and injury-plagued first season? The Packers thought they were driving improvement on the interior when they signed Banks to a big deal in free agency and moved Elgton Jenkins to center in 2025. It never happened. Banks was injured in one way or another for the better part of two months to start the season, and he ended up as a below average starter at left guard by the end of 2025. He needs to stay healthy and play a lot better in 2026. Of course, there's a chance the Packers balk at paying his massive roster bonus in March and decide to part ways, creating a big hole at left guard entering free agency and the draft. Green Bay might be stuck between a rock and a hard place -- paying big for an average left guard, or parting ways and further weakening the offensive line.

Who will be the center in 2026? Moving to Elgton Jenkins to center accomplished little, and he's almost certainly going to be cut at some point this offseason. Sean Rhyan flashed as a run blocker at center, but the Packers have benched him multiple times as a guard, and he's far from a guarantee to improve as a center. Also, Rhyan is a free agent, and it's possible the market will value him far higher than the Packers. Jacob Monk is probably not a long-term starting option. So where do the Packers go from here? Overpay to keep Rhyan, who might never be more than just a guy? Get aggressive to find a capable starter in free agency? Target one in the draft class? I picked center as the most important need position for the Packers to solve this offseason.

Can Anthony Belton improve in Year 2? Belton, a second-round pick who was first trained as a tackle, took over as the starter at right guard midseason and provided some flashes of mauling run-blocking ability down the stretch. But he was also highly inconsistent, and his down to down struggles as a pass blocker were evident in several big spots. It's fair to expect improvement. He'll get an offseason and training camp to settle into the guard position after playing mostly tackle in college and bouncing around the line as a rookie. But improvement is never guaranteed for a young player. Of the 71 guards who played at least 400 snaps in 2025, Belton ranked 68th in PFF grade.

Will Zach Tom be affected by his knee injury? Tom suffered a partially torn patellar tendon in Week 15 and missed the rest of the season. The offensive line fell apart in Denver and never really steadied the rest of the way. Tom is expected to have surgery, but the Packers are confident his 2026 season won't be affected. Still, this is a major injury for an offensive lineman -- and surgery on even a partial tear requires a long recovery process. The Packers need Tom -- their best offensive lineman -- to be available and at his best in 2026. He had a nightmarish 2025 season on the injury front, and his absences affected the whole unit.

This article originally appeared on Packers Wire: Question marks for each position along Packers offensive line

title: Ferrari's Leclerc shines on final day of F1 pre-season tests
description: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc completed more than two race distances and topped the timesheets on the final day of Formula One pre-season testing in Bahrain on Friday. Leclerc recorded 132 laps on the Sakhir course and no one came near his best time as world champion Lando Norris of McLaren was.
fullText:
Ferrari's Charles Leclerc completed more than two race distances and topped the timesheets on the final day of Formula One pre-season testing in Bahrain on Friday.

Leclerc recorded 132 laps on the Sakhir course and no one came near his best time as world champion Lando Norris of McLaren was .817 of a second back in second place.

Four-time world champion Max Verstappen was third with a deficit of more than a second and Mercedes driver George Russell fourth.

McLaren engineers worked for a lengthy period on Norris' car while Aston Martin ended the session prematurely and after a mere six laps. The team experienced battery problems since Thursday and ran out of spare parts.

As part of sweeping new rule changes, the battery must provide 50% of the energy for the cars' power units.

New team Audi had Gabriel Bortoleto in seventh and Nico H√ºlkenberg 15th.

Testing times give no clear indication of a team's strength as teams often have different testing programmes, fuel loads and tyres.

The season starts on March 8 with the Australian Grand Prix.

title: Giants might need to make Tyler Linderbaum the NFL‚Äôs richest center; is he worth it?
description: It might take the richest contract ever given to a center to bring Linderbaum to New York. Is he worth it?
fullText:
Tyler Linderbaum might be at the top of the New York Giants‚Äô NFL free agency wish list as they aim to upgrade in the trenches. Getting him, though, is not going to be easy. ‚ÄúEverybody‚Äù wants Linderbaum, according to NFL Network draft analyst Daniel Jeremiah.

‚ÄúI love my job, but if I could switch jobs for just the next couple months I‚Äôd want to be Tyler Linderbaum‚Äôs agent,‚Äù Jeremiah said Thursday on a pre-NFL Scouting Combine call with media. ‚ÄòEverybody that I talk to seems to be in on Tyler Linderbaum. It sounds like he‚Äôs going to have a robust market.‚Äú

Linderbaum, of course, was the center for Giants coach John Harbaugh with the Baltimore Ravens for the past four years. The 25th pick in the 2022 NFL Draft, Linderbaum was named to the Pro Bowl in each of his last three seasons.

Entering his age 26 season, Linderbaum is about to be a very rich young man. Creed Humphrey of the Kansas City Chiefs is the league‚Äôs highest-paid center. He signed a four-year, $72 million contract, an average of $18 million per year.

Linderbaum‚Äôs contract, especially with a ‚Äúrobust market,‚Äù figures to equal or exceed that figure.

The Ravens are hoping to keep Linderbaum in Baltimore.

‚ÄúWe got some work to do on Tyler Linderbaum‚Äôs contract,‚Äù DeCosta said on ‚ÄòThe Inner Circle Podcast.‚Äô ‚ÄúWe strongly hope to have him back. He‚Äôs a great player for us and a great leader.‚Äù

Do the Giants ‚Äúneed‚Äù Linderbaum badly enough to be willing to reset the center market financially? Perhaps not. John Michael Schmitz is a capable center who has improved in each of his first three seasons.

Linderbaum, though, would be an upgrade. Harbaugh, who has said consistently that continuing to upgrade the talent on both the offensive and defensive lines is a must for the Giants, might be willing to do whatever it takes to get the player who orchestrated his offensive line in Baltimore.

Is Linderbaum worth the biggest contract ever given to a center, Giants fans?

title: ‚Ç¨40m Barcelona star wanted in Saudi Arabia this summer
description: A member of the midfield ranks at La Liga champions Barcelona is wanted in the Middle East with a view to next season.That‚Äôs according to Fichajes, who highlight Marc Casad√≥ as the player in questi...
fullText:
A member of the midfield ranks at La Liga champions Barcelona is wanted in the Middle East with a view to next season.

That‚Äôs according to Fichajes, who highlight Marc Casad√≥ as the player in question.

Youngster Casad√≥ has of course seen speculation continue to swirl surrounding his name across the season to date.

This comes with the Spanish international struggling to lock down a consistent starting berth for himself in Hansi Flick‚Äôs Barcelona midfield ranks.

With the Blaugrana‚Äôs financial problems well documented, it has in turn been suggested that, for the right price, Casad√≥ could be lured away from the Spotify Camp Nou.

And as alluded to above, late this week, a new potential landing spot has been touted for the 22-year-old.

As per a report from Spanish news outlet Fichajes, an unnamed Saudi Pro League club ‚Äòare reportedly prepared to offer ‚Ç¨40 million to secure his signing‚Äô.

It is added that, for this fee, Barcelona would be willing to entertain negotiations over a sale.

title: 5Ô∏è‚É£ spicy fixtures you must watch this weekend üå∂
description: The best football fixtures of the coming weekend features the North London Derby, a huge cup clash, and action from Italy and Germany.¬†Five spicy fixtures you must watch this weekend:Chelsea Women vs...
fullText:
The best football fixtures of the coming weekend features the North London Derby, a huge cup clash, and action from Italy and Germany.

The fifth round of the Women‚Äôs FA Cup has thrown up some tasty matchups this weekend, the biggest of which sees Chelsea host Manchester United at Kingsmeadow on Sunday.

It‚Äôs a repeat of last year‚Äôs final, which the Blues won 1-0 at Wembley. The Red Devils are out for revenge and sit one point above the west London outfit in the Women‚Äôs Super League table. This is also a primer for next month‚Äôs League Cup final and promises to be a cracker.

There‚Äôs also the Merseyside Derby between Liverpool and Everton later in the day. It kicks off at the same time as the North London Derby in the Premier League, but this game will be on Channel 4, so it‚Äôs a perfect alternative if you have a Sky Sports subscription.

Kick-off: 1.30pm, Sunday 22nd February

Where to watch: TNT Sports 1, Discovery+

Iconic Duos ‚Äì Chelsea‚Äôs impregnable pairing made of steel and silk, Terry and Carvalho

The battle for Europe is intensifying in Serie A. Third-placed Napoli are in a strong position to qualify for next year‚Äôs UEFA Champions League, but with Juventus just four points adrift in fifth, they cannot afford to drop many points with 13 games to go.

Atalanta, who are five points off the top four, are outsiders to qualify for the competition, but a win here would make a huge statement. Their poor start to the campaign has been firmly put behind them under new manager Raffaele Palladino, who is yet to oversee a league defeat in 2026.

La Dea also cannot afford to drop points at this stage of the season given they are neck and neck with Cesc Fabregas‚Äô Como, who occupy sixth place and the UEFA Conference League qualifying spot.

Kick-off: 2pm, Sunday 22nd February

Where to watch: BBC Alba, BBC iPlayer, BBC Sport website, DAZN

Read ‚Äì Every player to score four goals in a Champions League game

The form side in the Bundesliga is not Bayern Munich, but Borussia Dortmund. They are are unbeaten in their last 15 league outings, and are currently enjoying a six-game winning streak.

That has brought them within five points of leaders Bayern, who were assumed to be champions-in-waiting yet again, but are cautiously looking over their shoulder at BVB.

Leipzig away is a tricky test for Dortmund, but also one they should be confident of passing if they want to challenge for the title.

Kick-off: 5.30pm, Saturday 21st February

Where to watch: Sky Sports Football

Read ‚Äì¬†90s Hitmen: The Divine Ponytail, Roberto Baggio

This is an absolutely huge game for Manchester City, who can at least temporarily close the gap to leaders Arsenal with a win at Eastlands on Saturday.

They will be heavy favourites against Newcastle United, who made the long jaunt to Azerbaijan in midweek. The Magpies will be buoyed by their 6-1 mauling of Qarabag, though, and will be out to prove that they can juggle European and domestic commitments against one of the best sides in the Premier League.

Kick-off: 8pm, Saturday 21st February

Where to watch: TNT Sports 1, TNT Sports Ultimate

Read ‚Äì¬†Guardiola ‚Äòcouldn‚Äôt care less‚Äô about title race ahead of Newcastle clash

There has not been such a gap in quality between Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal in well over two decades, perhaps even longer than that, but this is one of the most intriguing North London derbies in recent memory.

On paper, this should be a cakewalk for the Gunners. Their neighbours are in disarray and sacked their head coach after failing to win a single Premier League game in 2026 so far. But Mikel Arteta‚Äôs men are having problems of their own; their title charge is starting to come off the tracks after winning just two of their last seven games.

The total chaos displayed at the back in the lead-up to Wolves‚Äô late equaliser in midweek screamed of a team creaking under the pressure. But the question is: do Spurs have the means to take advantage?

The Lilywhites were dismantled when they went to the Emirates Stadium earlier this season, but they have a new man in the hot seat. The combination of a¬†new manager bounce from Igor Tudor and the desperation to stop their biggest rivals winning the title gives them added hope of getting something from a team on edge.

Kick-off: 4.30pm, Sunday 22nd February

Where to watch: Sky Sports Main Event, Sky Sports Premier League

title: Nathan MacKinnon went viral for his Olympic focus ‚Äî and it just made him Canada's hero
description: MacKinnon did right by his Canadian teammates.
fullText:
Nathan MacKinnon went viral for his Olympic focus ‚Äî and it just made him Canada's hero originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Nathan MacKinnon knew what he was doing.

At the start of these 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan, the Colorado Avalanche superstar was asked if he has to "take this all in."

"No," he replied to The Athletic, then elaborated. "I want to enjoy myself, but I'm not here to enjoy myself. I'm going to do everything I can to play well, and hopefully it's enough and hopefully I can contribute."

He was mocked on social media for his laser focus.

No one is mocking MacKinnon now.

MORE:¬†Megan Keller's childhood dreams culminate in a dream come true

He just sent Team Canada to the gold medal game with a powerplay goal with 35 seconds left against Finland in the Olympic semifinal on Friday.

MacKinnon, of course, isn't the only player on Canada's roster taking this tournament seriously. They all want a gold medal. It's the first time the NHL has been at the Olympics since 2014. It's MacKinnon's first chance.

The last time NHL players were at the Olympics, MacKinnon was an 18-year old rookie for Colorado who wasn't ready to be on the team.

A dozen years later, he already had 40 goals this season before the Olympic break.

MacKinnon, a Nova Scotia native like Sidney Crosby, had grown up watching Crosby lead Canada to glory.

With Crosby sidelined with an injury on Friday, everyone had to step up a bit.

But there was Canada, coming back, one goal, then another.

MORE:¬†A dog stole the show at the finish line of cross country skiing

They got a late powerplay, and that brought out one of the scariest units ever to take the hockey ice.

MacKinnon was the one who cashed in.

Turns out, his all-out focus was exactly what Team Canada needed.

Because of MacKinnon, Canada will play for the biggest prize in international hockey.

Mikaela Shiffrin just broke the Olympics

Czechia's go-ahead goal against Canada had 6 skaters on the ice

Controversy and cursing with Canada curling

NHL players' return to Olympics was meant for a day like that

title: How Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo Became the Winter Olympics GOAT
description: The Norwegian cross-country skier became the first Winter Olympian to reach the double-digit mark in career gold medals
fullText:
Gold medalist Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo of Norway competes during the team sprint free at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games on Feb 18, 2026. Credit - Davide Barbieri‚ÄîNordicFocus/Getty Images

When Norwegian cross-country skier Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo crossed the finish line first on Feb. 18, giving this country a victory in the men‚Äôs team sprint free event, he certified himself as the Winter Olympics GOAT. Klaebo, 29, won his fifth Olympic gold of these Milano Cortina Games, in five events, and became the first Winter Olympian ever to reach the double-digit mark in career gold medals. Klaebo goes for No. 11, on Saturday, in the 50-km mass start classic.

While prepping for the most prestigious race on the cross-country program, Klaebo took a break to talk to TIME about a wide range of subjects, including how Norway‚Äôs youth sports system produces Olympic champions, why he‚Äôs not spending much time with his family and fianc√©e, cross-country memes, and what‚Äôs on his bucket list.

[This interview has been condensed for length and clarity]

You‚Äôve won five gold medals during these Winter Olympics, set the new all-time winter record with 10 golds in your Olympic career, and if you win the 50-km mass start classic on Saturday, you‚Äôd be the first Winter Olympian to ever win six golds at the same Games. So what‚Äôs going through your mind right now?

I'm just trying to let everything sink in a little bit. Really eager to do well on Saturday. So it's kind of finding the balance, in terms of how much you will enjoy the moment and how much you are trying to prepare yourself for what's ahead. So far it feels really good. And now, with just one more race to go, it's going to be nice to wrap it all up.

So what can you do to enjoy the moments, knowing that you‚Äôve still got work to do?

We have a pretty good team here. So we try to stick together. We are eating long dinners. We have long lunches. When it comes to enjoying it too much, I have my family here and everything and just decided that's going to be too much. I don't have time to do everything. Having my girlfriend here as well, it's been just FaceTime. I haven‚Äôt been able to see her more than just saying hi at the stadium. So I think that's kind of the balance we are trying to figure out.

So you haven't seen your family or your fianc√©e in person, besides hugging after race victories? You haven‚Äôt had long dinners with them or anything? It's just with your team?

Absolutely. The last time I was back home was the start of January. I was there for two days. Besides that, I haven't been home since the start of December. I have 250 days away from home every single year. I tried to bring my fianc√©e as much as possible. But during the Olympics, with the accreditation and all these kinds of things, it‚Äôs really strict. It's easier for her to stay with my family and just have fun. Then I will join them on Saturday.

What are you going to do on Saturday night, win or lose?

We're going to have a nice dinner. That's kind of the minimum of what we're going to do. When I look back at this Olympics, they will for sure be unbelievable anyways. But it'd be cool to finish it up with this total sweep. So we'll see.

What‚Äôs been your favorite long meal with your team so far? What have you had to eat?

I'm pretty strict in terms of what I'm eating. During the Olympics, there's a lot of rice, chicken, and vegetables. So it's quite a boring dinner. The nice part is that we're actually sitting there for a long time, just trying to speak about the races. We speak about how privileged we are to be here and to enjoy this. This is my third Olympics. The last one in Beijing, for us athletes, you needed to test for COVID twice per day. We were eating with boxes on the side. It felt more like work. Here it feels like this is what I like to do. This is more my hobby. I think that is making a big difference, mentally especially.

People are fascinated by Norway‚Äôs Winter Olympic dominance. And a lot has been made about the youth sports system there, that keeping score is not allowed in kids‚Äô games. Is that really true? In cross-country, if you finish first, isn‚Äôt it obvious that you won?

When you're younger, like 8 to 12, if you're starting first, your name will be first on the start list, but on the side you will see your time. So say that you're 3 min. and 40 sec., and then the last one on the starting list is 3 min. and 28 sec. He was faster, but you needed to go into that and kind of look.

Ah, so they don‚Äôt put the results in order, just the start.

The reason is we want everyone to stay along for as long as possible. They try to not focus too much on the results. They're focusing more on participation and that people are there and having fun and enjoying the races, more than who is winning.

And you played other sports, I believe, besides cross-country. What are some of the other sports you tried?

I did a lot of things. I played soccer. That was kind of what I wanted to be when I grew up. But it didn't turn up that way. Then I was doing a little bit of track and field. I was cycling a little bit. I tried biathlon. I was playing an instrument. So I did a lot of things when I grew up, but the majority of my time was spent on the soccer field and also out running and doing stuff for cross-country.

Do you think the fact that you played all these different sports at least partially explains why we're seeing these results from you?

I think so. It's good when you are younger to try different sports and to be able to learn different patterns and movements. Then at some point you need to decide for sure. But I didn't decide before I was about 16. I still played soccer until I was close to 20. When you're playing soccer, you're doing shorter sprints, you're being a little bit more explosive. When you're cross-country skiing, it's more like endurance. It's a mix of everything. And that was what I tried to do when I was younger, to see if I can combine it as much as possible. And then these days, I think that has helped me a lot to be able to be at my best.

Your uphill sprint has gone viral. Have you enjoyed seeing the memes? What's your favorite one?

The one I think is the most fun is you see how fast I'm running, and then when people are just then trying to do the same on the treadmill. You see it's actually quite fast. It's cool to see that cross-country skiing has kind of gone a little bit viral, and to see people getting their eyes opened to what we are doing in cross-country skiing.

I'm from the United States, and on the men‚Äôs side, America has had its first Olympic cross-country medalists in 50 years. But cross-country is not beloved like it is in Norway. What do you want people to know in the United States, and other places around the world, about your sport that maybe they don't realize or don't see or don't appreciate?

A lot of people think it's all about endurance. But the good part about doing cross-country skiing is that we're using our legs, we're using the upper body, and you're using your endurance. Meaning that it's one of the healthiest sports you can do when it comes to staying active. I know that in the U.S., it's not possible to go skiing everywhere, as it is in Norway during the winter. But you can go roller skiing, which is pretty much the same. You're still using your upper and lower body and endurance. It's really less injury risk than doing cycling or running.

Has anyone from another sport tried to recruit you?

I‚Äôve gotten some questions about cycling. I'm close to 30 now, so I think it's a little bit too late to start exploring. I think I will stick to cross-country skiing.

Michael Phelps has the all-time Olympic record, with 23 golds. You might get 11 once you‚Äôre through here. Might you try to catch him? Is that a goal of yours, to become the all-time gold-medal winner in Olympic history?

That's going to be hard. Because then I need to do two more Olympics, and I need to win every single event. That will be quite crazy. I‚Äôm second. I think I‚Äôm going to stay second. It's cool to get the question. But I don't think it's that realistic, to be honest.

But when I say you're the greatest Winter Olympian of all time, do you agree with that?

It‚Äôs pretty crazy to hear that. It's unbelievable. My goal when I was younger was to be able to do cross-country skiing for a living. It‚Äôs just been way more than I could ever expect or dream about.

Some people would try to play down the Winter Olympics GOAT label. But it sounds like you accept that title. Fair?

The good part is that we actually have the numbers for it. For me, I will never try to go down that lane. To be honest, I think there are so many great athletes participating in the Olympics, whether it's freeskiing or it's skeleton. It's pretty sick to have the record, for sure. But I think it's important to mention that there are so many good athletes out there, and I have a huge respect for what everyone is accomplishing.

You can obviously do it all in your sport. The sprints and the distance. But what excites you about doing the 50-km distance race? What's the challenge of it?

There are so many changes during the race. You can feel really good after 20 km and then you can feel terrible after 30 km. You're going through so many different emotions. That‚Äôs the beauty about it. At some point you will be really tired, and at some point you will feel like you are unstoppable. You're two hours staying in your own head. You're just kind of working against yourself on so many levels.

Any fun facts people should know about you?

When I prepare myself for a race. I always play my PlayStation. So if you see back here, this is kind of my setup. [Shows gaming desk on video.] During summer, I like to play golf. When I had a couple of training camps in Utah, I always used to bring my golf clubs to be able to play a little bit on the rest days.

I‚Äôm sure you can keep your anonymity in Utah, though that may soon change.

Yeah, it's definitely a big difference. In Utah, it's easy. No one is recognizing you. I can just do my thing. It's actually very good when it comes to the altitude and all the terrain and everything. Roller skiing and cycling. It's really been a perfect place for me to stay.

What's difficult about being a celebrity in Norway?

I wouldn't say that it's difficult. But if you're going to just do your grocery shopping, it's not always that you are feeling at your best, stopping and getting your picture taken and everything. That's part of the game. Sometimes you would like to not get recognized. But on the other hand, I feel really privileged that people are watching our races and following us. It's very important for me to give back. I always try to say yes, because I remember how it was when I was younger. I had someone I looked up to and wanted to take a picture with. I would feel bad if that person didn't stop and say hi.

OK, a few quick ones to wrap up. What‚Äôs a bucket-list thing you want to do in life that you haven't done yet?

That's actually a really hard question. I don't know if it's a bucket list, but the plan is to go to the World Cup. I have a few friends that play on the national team in Norway. So I will travel to New York and then fly out to Boston to see the Norwegian team start their World Cup. That's something I'm really looking forward to.

Are you friends with Erling Haaland?

Not really. We have a few of the same sponsors. But Alexander S√∏rloth, another striker, is a good friend of mine. We normally have a vacation together every year. So we'll go to watch them, and then hopefully in the summer we'll have a vacation when they're done with the World Cup. Hopefully after a long World Cup for Norway.

We actually did a cover story on Erling last year, and he talked about how he eats cow heart. Do you eat cow heart too?

Oh no. I don't eat cow heart. But it‚Äôs kind of the same philosophy. It's all about eating clean. So we're eating clean meats. All of us are trying to optimize our body. The nutrition part is very important. I have this place where I always buy my meat. The next thing is going to be cow hearts, I guess.

What is the biggest challenge you've had in your life, and how did you overcome it?

One of the biggest ones was when I was 15. That was when I made my decision that I wanted to do cross-country skiing. And at that time I was around 100 in Norway on the result list. I was really small when I was 15. It was hard to compete against people that were twice as high as I was. I really, really struggled on the races. But I kept being patient and focusing on the thing that I could put my energy on, which was my technique and my balance. It took a couple of years before I started to grow. But when I first started to grow, I was starting to fight for the top positions in my country for my age. And that was nice.

Especially if you complete the six-gold sweep on Saturday and make more Olympic history, you‚Äôre going to be in high demand. Now‚Äôs the time to, say, meet anyone in the world you want. Who would you love to meet and spend some time with?

It would be cool to meet some of the big stars on the PGA Tour.

I know that he's not a part of the PGA tour that much right now, but Tiger Woods is one of the biggest there has ever been. He would definitely be up there.

Have you ever been to the Masters?

Never. That would be one of the coolest things to do.

If you win, you can request an invite right now to the Augusta National folks.

Well, I hope they read this and do the right thing. You deserve it, Come on, Augusta.

Write to Sean Gregory at sean.gregory@time.com.

title: Curt Cignetti contract details: Indiana football gives raise after CFP title run
description: Indiana football coach Curt Cignetti received a new contract on Friday, Feb. 20. What to know:
fullText:
Coach Curt Cignetti brought a national championship to Indiana football, and he's being paid handsomely for it.

The second-year Hoosiers coach received a new contract on Friday, Feb. 20, according to the IndyStar, part of the USA TODAY Network. It's his third contract revision at Indiana, and will pay him an average of $13.2 million per season, among the highest in college sports.

REQUIRED READING: Five college football hot seats I can't stop thinking about for 2026

Indiana and Cignetti capped off a perfect 16-0 season with their national championship win over Miami in January, which came two seasons after the Hoosiers went 3-9 in Tom Allen's last season as head coach. The program entered the 2025-26 season with three bowl wins ever, yet won three CFP games en route to a title.

It's clear Indiana is continuing to invest in its skyrocketing football program, and it doesn't seem like they're leaving anywhere soon.

Here's everything to know of Cignetti's new contract:

Cignetti's new contract will pay him an average annual salary of $13.2 million through 2033. His previous contract was also through 2033, but was for $11.6 million per season.

The contract makes him among the highest-paid coach in college sports, next to LSU's Lane Kiffin and Georgia's Kirby Smart, who are also making $13 million or more per season on average. Kiffin signed a seven-year, $91 million deal with LSU after leaving Ole Miss and Smart is on a 13-year, $130 million contract.

Cignetti's contract he signed in October featured a clause that called for a "good faith market review" of his deal within 120 days of Indiana reaching the CFP semifinals, should it ever reach it. The contract is also designed to keep him within the top three of highest-paid coaches in college football.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Curt Cignetti contract: Indiana football gives raise after CFP title

title: Two more Georgia football players arrested
description: The Georgia Bulldogs had a pair of players arrested on driving charges including UGA's 2025 sack leader
fullText:
Two more Georgia Bulldogs football players have been arrested. Georgia already had walk-on defensive lineman London Seymour arrested this offseason. Seymour faces 11 felonies.

Georgia linebackers Chris Cole and Darren Ikinnagbon were both arrested and later released on Wednesday, Feb. 18. Both players were charged with misdemeanors including reckless driving.

Cole was arrested at 9:59 p.m. ET according to Athens-Clarke County online jail records. He was charged with reckless driving and speeding, which are both misdemeanors. Cole was released after paying $26 in bonds.

Ikinnagbon was arrested at 10:27 p.m. ET. He was charged with reckless driving, speeding and following too closely, which are all misdemeanors. Ikinnagbon was released after paying $39 in bonds.

Cole and Ikinnagbon are Georgia's latest players to be arrested for a driving incident following the tragic deaths of Georgia recruiting analyst Chandler LeCroy and Devon Willock in a 2023 car crash. Georgia did not specify if either player is facing discipline, but the Bulldogs have dismissed three players from driving incidents since the spring of 2025.

Cole led Georgia in sacks with 4 1/2 during the 2025 season. Ikinnagbon appeared in five games in his freshman season in 2025 and posted two tackles.

"I want to apologize for my actions and poor decision I made yesterday in Athens," Ikinnagbon said in a statement after his arrest. "As a member of the University of Georgia football team, I recognize that my behavior fell short of the standards expected from anyone who represents this program."

Ikinnagbon added further in his full statement (below). Cole released a similar statement following his arrest too.

Statement from Darren Ikinnagbon following Wednesday‚Äôs arrest on misdemeanor vehicular charges‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/FcmtHvbV12

‚Äî Anthony Dasher (@AnthonyDasher1) February 19, 2026

Statement from Georgia linebacker Chris Cole following Wednesday‚Äôs arrest for vehicular-related charges‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/9XEwVyIuTY

‚Äî Anthony Dasher (@AnthonyDasher1) February 19, 2026

Follow UGA Wire on¬†Instagram¬†or¬†Threads¬†for more Georgia football coverage!

This article originally appeared on UGA Wire: Georgia's sack leader among 2 UGA players arrested

title: Diamondbacks open Cactus League against Rockies with glimpse of 2026 potential
description: SCOTTSDALE ‚Äî As Cactus League games are officially underway, the Arizona Diamondbacks are getting a preview of what could be in store in the regular season. Arizona Diamondbacks Nolan Arenado (center) during spring training workouts at Salt River Fields on Feb.
fullText:
SCOTTSDALE ‚Äî As Cactus League games are officially underway, the Arizona Diamondbacks are getting a preview of what could be in store in the regular season.

Arizona Diamondbacks Nolan Arenado (center) during spring training workouts at Salt River Fields on Feb. 16, 2026, in Scottsdale. ¬© Rob Schumacher/The Republic / USA TODAY NETWORK via Imagn Images

The Diamondbacks open their Spring Training against National League West division rival the Colorado Rockies.

At the top are second baseman Ketel Marte and shortstop Geraldo Perdomo, who continue to hold down two of the top three spots in the batting order. They‚Äôre followed by Pavin Smith as the designated hitter, with catcher Gabriel Moreno in the cleanup spot.

The team has also added veterans Nolan Arenado and Carlos Santana ‚Äî playing for Arizona for the first time ‚Äî into the mix, along with young outfielders Alek Thomas, Ryan Waldschmidt and Jorge Barrosa to round out the batting order.

Arizona Diamondbacks‚Äô Pavin Smith during spring training workouts at Salt River Fields on Feb. 16, 2026, in Scottsdale. ¬© Rob Schumacher/The Republic / USA TODAY NETWORK via Imagn Images

Right-handed pitcher Thomas Hatch will open the game for Arizona. Hatch signed with the club on a minor league contract in January after splitting time between Kansas City and Minnesota last season. He finished 2025 with a 5.82 ERA, 22 strikeouts and a 1.68 WHIP.

The lineup is filled with established stars and newcomers, suggesting this could be a group manager Torey Lovullo works with as the year progresses. A few notable names are absent from the club‚Äôs first game, including Corbin Carroll and Lourdes Gurriel Jr., who are both still recovering from injuries but aren‚Äôt expected to miss significant time.

One outfielder who is also missing is Jake McCarthy, who will participate in Friday‚Äôs game but not in Sedona Red. McCarthy will make his Rockies debut in center field while hitting leadoff.

Arizona Diamondbacks catcher Gabriel Moreno (14) talks to pitcher Brandon Pfaadt (32) during spring training workouts at Salt River Fields on Feb. 16, 2026, in Scottsdale. ¬© Rob Schumacher/The Republic / USA TODAY NETWORK via Imagn Images

The Diamondbacks will face right-handed pitcher Antonio Senzatela, who finished the 2025 season with a 6.65 ERA, 73 strikeouts and a 1.84 WHIP.

While Spring Training games are designed to prepare players for the regular season, they represent more than just a preseason tune-up. Many players use this time as an opportunity to build chemistry and develop a deeper understanding of the organization. With several new faces on the roster, this year‚Äôs camp could prove to be one of the most important in recent memory for the Snakes.

As the team opens its Cactus League schedule, Friday‚Äôs matchup may offer a glimpse of what‚Äôs to come for the Diamondbacks in 2026.

The D-backs and Rockies face off Friday, Feb. 20, at 1:10 p.m.

Diamondbacks‚Äô Corbin Carroll and Kevin Ginkel eager for Mexico series against Padres

title: Shedeur Sanders lands on ESPN's Top 100 quarterback's list
description: Shedeur Sanders made an undeniable impact on Colorado football, which helped him earn a spot on ESPN's top 100 quarterbacks of the 2000s list.
fullText:
Following the 2025 Colorado Buffaloes season and Shedeur Sanders' rollercoaster, it might be hard to remember that just over two years ago, Sanders was leading the charge of rebuilding Colorado football.

Alongside Travis Hunter and his father, Deion Sanders, Shedeur played a key part in reviving a stagnant program during a time of conference uncertainty. It's part of the reason why so many No. 12 jerseys, both of black and gold and brown and orange, can be found across the nation, especially in Boulder. For his efforts, he was also recently named to ESPN's list of the top 100 quarterbacks of the 2000s.

Sanders slots in at No. 87, right in between Western Kentucky's Bailey Zappe and Miami's Carson Beck. The list only counts years in the FBS, of which Sanders played two, totaling 7,364 passing yards, 64 touchdowns and only 13 interceptions. Throughout his two-year stint in the FBS, in which he threw over 900 times, Sanders set a new record for completion percentage in a career at 71.8%.

During the Buffaloes 9-4 season, Sanders threw for 4,134 yards, 37 touchdowns and 10 interceptions, all while completeing 74% of his passes. His passing led the Big 12 in nearly every category that season, which led to his being drafted by the Cleveland Browns in the NFL.

10 minutes of Shedeur Sanders‚Äô highlights pic.twitter.com/AJMWtvrjvW

‚Äî Colorado Buffaloes Football (@CUBuffsFootball) April 26, 2025

While the list doesn't take it into account, Sanders was no slouch in the FCS ranks before landing in Colorado. Playing for his father at Jackson State for two years, Sanders threw for 70 touchdowns, nearly 7,000 yards and only 14 interceptions. Together, the Sanders' family lost only three games during their time with the Tigers, ending with an elite 23-3 record in that span.

title: Union Berlin vs. Bayer Leverkusen
description: Union BerlinUnion are still searching for their first win of 2026 after failing to win all of their seven Bundesliga matches since the turn of the year (D4, L3). In fact, Steffen Baumgart‚Äôs side hav...
fullText:
Union are still searching for their first win of 2026 after failing to win all of their seven Bundesliga matches since the turn of the year (D4, L3). In fact, Steffen Baumgart‚Äôs side have lost three of their previous four matches, including a 3-2 loss in last Saturday‚Äôs away clash against Hamburg. As a result of their poor form, Union have slipped into the bottom half of the table, although they still boast a healthy six-point gap to the bottom three.

They will be desperate to claim their first league win since December in Saturday‚Äôs home fixture, but that will be easier said than done for a club that has not beaten Leverkusen since picking up a 1-0 victory in January 2021. The first goal could dictate Union‚Äôs chances of victory, given the fact that they have failed to win any of the 11 Bundesliga games in which they have conceded first this term (D4, L7).

Union are unable to call upon the services of Diogo Leite, Tom Roth, Josip Juranoviƒá and Robert Skov.

Predicted lineup: R√∏nnow; Doekhi, Querfeld, Nsoki; Haberer, Khedira, Kemlein, K√∂hn; Jeong, Burke; Iliƒá

In contrast to their hosts, Leverkusen will head into the weekend in high spirits after winning six of their previous seven competitive matches (D1), including their last two. Kasper Hjulmand's side cruised to a 4-0 victory in last Saturday‚Äôs Bundesliga home clash with St. Pauli, before they recorded a 2-0 success in Thursday‚Äôs Europa League meeting with Olympiacos. Patrik Schick‚Äôs quickfire brace has put Leverkusen in a strong position in their knockout phase playoff tie ahead of next week‚Äôs return leg at the BayArena.

While they may have one eye on the second leg, Leverkusen will turn their focus back to their Champions League qualification bid. As it stands, Leverkusen are sitting in sixth spot and three points adrift of the top four after winning 12, drawing three and losing six of their 21 league matches this season.

They should fancy their chances of taking maximum points from Saturday‚Äôs fixture, having won four of their previous five games against Union, including a 2-0 victory in October‚Äôs reverse fixture.

Goalkeeper Mark Flekken remains sidelined with a knee injury, while Eliesse Ben Seghir and Nathan Tella are out with ankle and foot injuries respectively.

title: The What-If That Could Have Changed Lions History Forever
description: Former Saints LT Terron Armstead reveals that players wanted Dan Campbell to replace Sean Payton in 2019. A stunning what-if moment for the Lions.
fullText:
Detroit Lions fans already know Dan Campbell is different. The emotion, the buy-in, the culture‚Äînone of it feels manufactured. And now, thanks to a revealing story from former New Orleans Saints left tackle Terron Armstead, we‚Äôve learned just how deep that belief in Campbell ran years before he ever stepped foot in Detroit.

Back in 2019, according to Armstead, some Saints players were so fed up with Sean Payton flirting with the Dallas Cowboys job that they were openly hoping Payton would leave‚Äîso Dan Campbell could take over as head coach.

Toward the end of Payton‚Äôs tenure in New Orleans, rumors swirled that he badly wanted the Cowboys job. Those whispers weren‚Äôt limited to media circles‚Äîthey made their way into the locker room.

There‚Äôs even a now-infamous story from Pro Football Talk‚Äôs Mike Florio suggesting the Saints and Cowboys had a deal in place in 2019, only for it to collapse because Anthony Davis requested a trade, putting Saints GM Mickey Loomis in an impossible optics situation‚Äîlosing Payton and Davis in the same offseason.

Wild? Absolutely. But believable? Apparently enough that Saints players were already planning for life after Payton.

Appearing on the St. Brown Podcast, Armstead didn‚Äôt sugarcoat how players felt at the time.

‚ÄúIt was a point, we was damn-near petitioning to get Sean Payton to get up out of there,‚Äù Armstead said as quoted by Pride of Detroit. ‚ÄúWe kept hearing rumors of Sean entertaining the Cowboys job, and we were like, ‚ÄòIf Sean goes to Dallas, Dan Campbell is going to be our head coach. So, Sean, you do what‚Äôs best for you and your family. We‚Äôve got Dan Campbell.‚Äô‚Äù

That quote hits different when you remember Campbell wasn‚Äôt even a coordinator. He was the assistant head coach and tight ends coach‚Äîand yet, the locker room already viewed him as their guy.

What‚Äôs especially telling is that Armstead wasn‚Äôt even coached directly by Campbell. And it didn‚Äôt matter.

‚ÄúHe was intense. He loves it. He loves the grind, he loves workers, he loves o-linemen,‚Äù Armstead said.
‚ÄúHe loves to run the ball and be physical. He was incredible, bro. We loved Dan.‚Äù

If that sounds familiar to Lions fans‚Ä¶ it should.

That‚Äôs the same identity Detroit has built:

Coaches who mean it when they talk about work

Campbell didn‚Äôt grow into this persona in Detroit. This is who he‚Äôs always been.

Here‚Äôs the part that should make Lions fans pause for a second.

If Payton had gone to Dallas in 2019‚Äîand Campbell had taken over the Saints‚Äîhe almost certainly wouldn‚Äôt have been available in 2021, when Detroit hired him.

Which raises the uncomfortable (but fascinating) question: Where would the Lions be right now without Dan Campbell?

It‚Äôs hard to imagine Detroit‚Äôs turnaround without him. The culture shift. The trust. The emotional edge. All of it traces back to Campbell being in the right place at the right time.

Sometimes franchise-altering moments don‚Äôt happen on draft night or in free agency. Sometimes they happen because a different team didn‚Äôt make a move.

This story doesn‚Äôt diminish Sean Payton‚Äôs success. But it does reinforce something Lions fans have felt for years now:

Players don‚Äôt just respect Dan Campbell‚Äîthey believe in him.

They believed in him in New Orleans.
They believe in him in Detroit.
And that belief is the foundation of everything the Lions are building right now.

The post The What-If That Could Have Changed Lions History Forever appeared first on Detroit Sports Nation.

title: Is Jaylen Brown suing Bevery Hills after police incident?
description: Jaylen Brown is upset after Beverly Hills police shut down his party during All-Star weekend.
fullText:
The city of Beverly Hills has issued an apology to Jaylen Brown after police shut down his brand party during NBA All-Star Weekend. An apology might not be enough for the Boston Celtics star, though.

Police ended Brown's private party at 7 p.m. Saturday over apparent city code violations, city manager Nancy Hunt-Coffey said in a statement. Brown told ESPN's Marc Spears police were operating on "biased information," leading to "serious due-process concerns."

A statement from the city of Beverly Hills confirmed police had at least some inaccurate information.

"Upon further internal review, the City has determined that its prior public communication contained inaccurate information," Beverly Hills' statement read. "Specifically, no permit application was submitted nor denied for the event and the residence does not have any prior related violations on record. The City takes full accountability for the internal error that resulted in the inaccurate statement being distributed and is working to ensure it does not happen again."‚ÄúThe City‚Äôs previous statement about the weekend event at the Trousdale home was inaccurate, and on behalf of the City, I would like to apologize to Jaylen Brown and the Jannard family,‚Äù Hunt-Coffey added. ‚ÄúThe City has a responsibility to its residents and neighborhoods to ensure adherence to established regulations for events held at private residences. These are designed to support the safety and welfare of neighbors and attendees. City staff observed circumstances that are believed to be City code violations and for that reason alone, the event was ended.‚Äù

Brown is reportedly considering legal action against Beverly Hills. The five-time All-Star told ESPN he's not a litigious person but feels "embarrassed" and "offended" over an incident he says caused "significant financial and reputational harm."

The event cost at least $600,000, according to ESPN, as Brown says he spent $300,000 while his sponsors contributed around $300,000 to $500,000. It's more than the money for Brown, however. It's also about losing an opportunity to discuss leadership and culture during the one weekend where the NBA's best and brightest come together.

"I wanted to enjoy myself, and I felt that got taken away," Brown told reporters after Thursday's win over the Golden State Warriors. "I was embarrassed. If it happened to me, I'm sure it happened to a bunch of people in the past. I look at it like that. There are probably a bunch of people that don't scream, falls on deaf fears, which is unfortunate. I'm not sure what the conclusion is. ... Even the statement that they put out, they included some stuff that wasn't true, even in the apology.

"So I don't think the apology is acceptable. I lost a lot of money [with our] partners, et cetera. People were making assumptions that we didn't go through the proper protocols. So, all around it's just a bad taste in my mouth. I'm extremely offended. My team is offended. I'm not sure what the conclusion is going to be. All I know is it's some (expletive)."

Brown is expected to make a decision on whether he'll pursue legal action soon.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Is Jaylen Brown suing Bevery Hills after police incident?

title: Napoli star Scott McTominay on his future: ‚ÄúMy agent has spoken to nobody else‚Äù
description: Napoli midfielder Scott McTominay clarified the situation surrounding his future, especially reports linking him with other clubs over a potential move in the summer transfer window.¬†Speaking in an e...
fullText:
Napoli midfielder Scott McTominay clarified the situation surrounding his future, especially reports linking him with other clubs over a potential move in the summer transfer window.

Speaking in an exclusive interview with Corriere dello Sport, the former Manchester United player poured cold water over rumours that suggested a move away for McTominay from Napoli. The Scottish midfielder charted his transfer from the Premier League to the Serie A, and then moved on to comment that his agent has talked with no other club regarding his future. He said: ‚ÄúMy agent hasn‚Äôt spoken to anyone about my future. He only talks to the club and me. He hasn‚Äôt said anything to the newspapers. I‚Äôm extremely happy here, and as for me, I‚Äôm a Napoli player; that‚Äôs all I think about. The future is very important, and I could see myself at Napoli for a long time.‚Äù

McTominay further reinforced his statement by reporting that he and his family are pleased with the city of Naples and the club, which gave him a space to improve after leaving a tough situation at Manchester United. The 29-year-old remarked: ‚ÄúMy family is happy, I‚Äôm happy. It‚Äôs a fantastic moment, I‚Äôve experienced something different from the last year and a half. As long as everyone in my life is happy, I am too.‚Äù

The Napoli proceeded to explain his own role as a footballer on the pitch as he said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been a midfielder, a number 8 who can do a bit of everything: get in the mix, but also help the team in build-up play, in defence, someone who gives his teammates a hand, in short.‚Äù

title: UGA football players apologize for reckless driving arrests
description: A pair of University of Georgia football players have issued an apology for their reckless driving and speeding charges.  Athens-Clarke Police arrested Christopher Cole and Darren Ikinnagbon on Wednesday after officers caught them driving 100 mph on the Outer Loop near Olympic Drive.
fullText:
A pair of University of Georgia football players have issued an apology for their reckless driving and speeding charges.

Athens-Clarke Police arrested Christopher Cole and Darren Ikinnagbon on Wednesday after officers caught them driving 100 mph on the Outer Loop near Olympic Drive. Both players were booked and posted bond set for less than $40.

[DOWNLOAD: Free WSB-TV News app for alerts as news breaks]

Cole and Ikinnagbon each posted a statement on their Instagram stories on Thursday. They both apologized for their actions, that they recognize the seriousness of what happened and that they understand the program‚Äôs standards.

‚ÄúThis has been a tough and embarrassing lesson for me, and I‚Äôm committed to learning from it, making smarter decisions and earning back your trust through my actions moving forward,‚Äù Cole wrote.

‚ÄúAs I continue to grow and develop as a young man, I am focused on making better decisions and learning from every experience. I respect the process and will cooperate fully as this matter is reviewed,‚Äù Ikinnagbon wrote.

Both players apologized to not only the coaches and players, but the fans as well.

title: Hunter Hess trolls Donald Trump after public diss, Olympic qualifying run
description: It‚Äôs not often that an athlete ‚Äî from the United States, or anywhere ‚Äî uses the platform of the Olympics to send an angry message to his own president. Then again, it‚Äôs not often that a sitting president calls one‚Ä¶
fullText:
It‚Äôs not often that an athlete ‚Äî from the United States, or anywhere ‚Äî uses the platform of the Olympics to send an angry message to his own president.

Then again, it‚Äôs not often that a sitting president calls one of the athletes representing his own country a ‚Äúloser.‚Äù

MORE: Mikaela Shiffrin sends 2-word message after winning Olympic gold medal

So it was that skiier Hunter Hess formed his left hand in the shape of an ‚ÄúL‚Äù on Friday ‚Äî a response, he said, to President Donald Trump calling him a ‚Äúloser‚Äù on social media.

Hunter Hess says he flashed an L after his Olympic halfpipe qualifying run as a response to Donald Trump's comments about him.

"Apparently, I'm a loser."

Hess added: "I worked so hard to be here. I sacrificed my entire life to make this happen. I'm not going to let controversy‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/RIdWARLPSw

‚Äî The Sporting News (@sportingnews) February 20, 2026

At a news conference at the start of the Milan-Cortina Olympics, skiers were asked how they felt about representing the country while the Department of Homeland Security under Trump has resulted in four known shooting deaths.

‚ÄúIf it aligns with my moral values, I feel like I‚Äôm representing it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúJust because I‚Äôm wearing the flag doesn‚Äôt mean I represent everything that‚Äôs going on in the U.S.‚Äù

U.S. Olympic Skier, Hunter Hess, a real Loser, says he doesn‚Äôt represent his Country in the current Winter Olympics. If that‚Äôs the case, he shouldn‚Äôt have tried out for the Team, and it‚Äôs too bad he‚Äôs on it. Very hard to root for someone like this. MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!

(TS:‚Ä¶

‚Äî Commentary: Trump Truth Social Posts On X (@TrumpTruthOnX) February 8, 2026

Trump responded to Hess‚Äô remarks on his Truth Social account: ‚ÄúHess, a real Loser, says he doesn‚Äôt represent his Country in the current Winter Olympics. If that‚Äôs the case, he shouldn‚Äôt have tried out for the Team, and it‚Äôs too bad he‚Äôs on it.‚Äù

Hess, a freestyle skier in men‚Äôs freeski halfpipe, ranked fifth in the field after two runs in Friday‚Äôs qualifying round.
